comments:
Tasks disappear from task list when I restart Eclipse. I also found this message
in Eclipse log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.mylar.core 4 0 2005-11-04 10:44:13.010
!MESSAGE Tasks may have been lost from TaskCategory

Tried to debug the issue but couldn't reproduce it inside PDE launched platform.
After tinkering with Mylar task list directory (setting it to some other
directory and back to /home/alex/workspace/.mylar) and removing all
org.eclipse.mylar.* plugin data in workspace .metadata, it works in my primary
Eclipse installation as well.
It would be nice if root cause exception was logged together with message

The problem is actually that activated tasks are not picked up on startup.
Disregard my previous comment about it working after changing setting.

Sorry, root cause stack trace is also present in log:

ENTRY org.eclipse.mylar.core 4 0 2005-11-04 13:24:50.541
!MESSAGE Tasks may have been lost from Task

!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.ui.actions.TaskActivateAction.run(TaskActivateAction.java:53)
        at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.DefaultTaskListExternalizer.readTaskInfo(DefaultTaskListExternalizer.java:221)
        at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.DefaultTaskListExternalizer.readTask(DefaultTaskListExternalizer.java:202)
        at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.internal.TaskListExternalizer.readTaskList(TaskListExternalizer.java:273)
        at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.TaskListManager.readTaskList(TaskListManager.java:63)
        at
org.eclipse.mylar.tasklist.MylarTasklistPlugin$4.run(MylarTasklistPlugin.java:251)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
        at
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:2886)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2608)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1755)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1719)
        at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:368)
        at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:143)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:106)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:226)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:377)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:164)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:338)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:282)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

Well, it seems I finally found the cause. I had Mylar task list as fast view,
in which case MylarTasklistPlugin.taskListManager is not initialized, leading to
NullPointerException later on.

Fixed for 0.4.1 (scheduled for tonight), and the code is now defensive against
this sort of nasty UI failure that leads to items being lost.  To avoid
triggering the bug today make sure that you don't leave any tasks active when
closing Eclipse.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 114318 ***
And thanks for the detective work Aleksander, that's always appreciated :)
